dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, have you seen the, um, the latest headlines about Jeff Bezos? This is just wild.

dialogue_turns.text: Wild is an understatement, A! [overlaps] I saw something flash, but I honestly couldn't believe it. Is it true?

dialogue_turns.text: It is, apparently. He was declared bankrupt, like, August 1st and 2nd. Can you even imagine?

dialogue_turns.text: Oh my goodness. The richest man on Earth, at one point, now in debt by that much? The irony is just... it's palpable.

dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And here's another kicker: an Amazon spokesman confirmed the stock sales weren't for Blue Origin, which everyone assumed. It was to fund a restaurant chain he founded back in, uh, September 2000.

dialogue_turns.text: A restaurant chain? [overlaps] No way! I remember him denying that he was funding Blue Origin with stock sales back in 2017, saying it was for a children's toy line instead. So which is it?

dialogue_turns.text: And then, to add insult to injury, those SEC filings... he bought over half a million Amazon shares when they were, what, $1,900 a share?
